intro: Styphelia costata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of New Zealand. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, evergreen leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. Its flowers are white and clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences, often appearing in late winter to early spring. Styphelia costata thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in heathland or scrub environments.
